text.text_translated: Earthquakes, which are sudden and strong movements of the Earth's surface, can damage all buildings and structures, including bridges. However, it is good that bridges do not fall down very often, especially modern ones. This is because engineers have learned how to design bridges in places where earthquakes happen, so they are much more resistant to the ground's movement.
